definitions.definition: The study of the nature of disease and its causes, processes, development, and consequences; now usually and especially in the clinical and academic medicine subsenses defined below.

subdefinitions.definition: The clinical biomedical specialty that provides microscopy and other laboratory services to clinicians (e.g., cytology , histology , cytopathology , histopathology , cytometry ).
examples: The surgeon sent a specimen of the cyst to the hospital's pathology department for staining and analysis to determine its histologic subtype.

subdefinitions.definition: The academic biomedical specialty that advances the aspects of the biomedical sciences that allow for those clinical applications and their advancements over time.
examples: Those three pioneering pathologists went on to become leaders in building the pathology departments at several universities.

subdefinitions.definition: Any of several interrelated scientific disciplines that advance the aspects of the life sciences that allow for such technological applications and their advancements over time.
examples: the plant pathology and vertebrate pathology programs of the university's biology department

definitions.definition: Pathosis : any deviation from a healthy or normal structure or function; abnormality ; illness or malformation.
examples: Some sort of renal pathology was suspected, but imaging and even biopsy found no discernible pathology , glomerular or otherwise.
Some sort of mental and social pathology seemed to sweep over the discourse later that autumn.

main_definition: The study of the nature of disease and its causes, processes, development, and consequences; now usually and especially in the clinical and academic medicine subsenses defined below.
secondary_definitions: Pathosis : any deviation from a healthy or normal structure or function; abnormality ; illness or malformation.
